label: Protests against Jean-Claude Duvalier
description: Hundreds of protesters march against Jean-Claude Duvalier, particularly changes to the Constitution. Many call for the army to overthrow the dictatorship

label: Jean Dominique viewing Je Suis Belle Movie Poster
description: Jean Dominique, owner and anchor of Radio Haiti, looks on at a promotional poster for Haiti's first documentary film, an ironic film about Caribbean beauty pageants. Dominique's cinema club was banned by François Duvalier for showing Alain Resnais's Holocaust documentary, Night and Fog.

label: Anchors at Radio Haiti
description: Marvel Dandin, Liliane Pierre-Paul, and Sony Bastien anchoring the evening newspaper, Format 30 on 1330 on Radio Haiti-Inter

label: Staff of Radio Haiti-Inter
description: Jean Dominique, and the staff of Radio Haiti-Inter

label: Cartoon of Jean-Claude Duvalier
description: Cartoon of Jean-Claude Duvalier, who became president-for-life after his father's passing in 1971.

label: Dechoukaj in Little Haiti
description: Haitian residing in the Little Haiti section of Miami celebrate the fall of the Duvalier dictatorship after issuance of an erroneous statement from the US government

label: Celebration of the overthrow of Jean-Claude Duvalier
description: Haitian residents in Miami celebrate an erroneous report of the fall of the Duvalier dictatorship

label: Mouvement Patriotique Haitien members
description: Clement S. Benoit, ex-consul General and leader of Mouvement Patriotique Haitien, an is photographed at at the airport in Nassau awaiting a flight to Miami by order of the Bahamian government.

label: Pro-Duvalier march in Port-au-Prince
description: Thousands attend a march in support of the Duvalier regime.

label: Anti-Duvalier march in Washington, DC
description: Protestors, demanding that the US break ties with the Haitian government, gather outside of the White House. Many had fled Haiti and resettled in the US

label: Francois Duvalier with member of his cabinet
description: François Duvalier and member of his government inside of the National Palace.

label: Francois Duvalier in National Palace
description: François Duvalier seated with foreign dignitary and his cabinet secretaries.

label: Jean-Claude Duvalier and Michele Bennett
description: Jean-Claude Duvalier and first lady Michele Bennett attend an official ceremony.

label: Jean-Claude Duvalier greets crowd
description: Jean-Claude Duvalier holds a pistol, as he and his mother Simone Duvalier, greet a crowd.

label: Tontons Macoutes
description: Tontons Macoutes are photographed at attention and surround Madame Max Adolphe, head warden of Fort Dimanche prison and Supreme Head of the Fillette Laleau, a female branch of the Tontons Macoutes

label: François Duvalier and Simone Duvalier
description: Francois Duvalier and first lady Simone Duvalier are pictured with cabinet members and members of the Haitian army.

label: Mouvement Patriotique Haitien members
description: Member of the anti-government group, Mouvement Patriotique Haïtien

label: Jean-Claude Duvalier delivers speech
description: Jean-Claude Duvalier delivers a speech with his mother, SImone Duvalier, looking on.

label: Jean-Claude Duvalier and First Lady Michele Bennett
description: Jean-Claude Duvalier and Michelle Duvalier stand in front of L'Eglise St. Pierre a Baraderes to confer military honors.
